messages.title: I'LL STAND UP FOR BRITAIN
messages.content:
As your Prime Minister, leading these negotiations at this crucial time in our country's history, I'll stand up for Britain and fight to guarantee our nation's economic security, our national security and our place in the world.
I'll stand up for, I'll respect, and I'll fight to deliver what the British people voted for in last year's referendum.
I'll stand up for Britain to guarantee our economic security, so we can deliver better-paying jobs for people in Plymouth, Sutton and Devonport and in every part of our country. And I'll make things fairer for them, by controlling and reducing the number of people who come to Britain when we leave the EU.
I'll stand up for Britain to keep our economy strong, so we can pay for a strong NHS, a good school place for every child and real technical education for more young people.
And with that strong economy, we can do more to help local families with action to cap unfair energy price rises, introduce new rights and protections for workers and help more people have a home of their own by building more affordable homes.

messages.title: STAND WITH ME TO HELP STRENGTHEN MY BREXIT HAND
messages.content:
I'll stand up for Britain, and I'm asking you to stand with me to help strengthen my hand.
If we stand together and get Brexit right, there is so much opportunity for Britain as we leave the European Union.
But if we don't get Brexit right, the consequences for everyone in Britain and everyone here in Plymouth, Sutton and Devonport will be serious – with fewer jobs, a weaker economy and a threat to the funding of our vital public services.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Guarantee the best possible deal from Brexit and ensure the country's economic and national security.
Deliver better-paying jobs for people across the country.
Control and reduce the number of people coming to Britain after leaving the EU.
Ensure a strong NHS and a good school place for every child.
Take action to cap unfair energy price rises, introduce new rights and protections for workers, and build more affordable homes.

In this ... election, which I called to secure the strong and stable leadership our country needs, you can vote for me or Jeremy Corbyn.
